transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Instead of over to the desk, theme music, cold open, opening remarks. I get it...

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: You got it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, you're saying, cold open first, then the theme music...

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Mmm hmm.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ... then we hit them with opening remarks...

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ... then, then I go to the desk.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's different.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) So, you're saying, cold open -

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Uh, it's, it's a continuity thing, y'see, you can't have a cold open after the theme.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmm hmm, gotcha.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Okay. Places, everybody. Zorak? Ready to go with the theme music?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, hang on a minute. (plays the keys, the opening vocals of "Hit Single" play.) 'Ere we go.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Okay, people, less than two days before the big premier. Today we're rollin' tape on this stand-in guest, this guy, uh, Fred... Schneider? Um, before the real deal on Friday, okay?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Is this thing on? (eyes spin, with Indian chanting in background)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Whoa, Zorak! Save some for Friday night, huh?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Y'know, this sound effect isn't working for me, it's, too wacky.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Eh, you're right, y'know what, I'll pull some stuff tonight. Okay, everybody, look alive, cue music and title page, we're rolling tape this time.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (practicing power band moves) And destroy, two, three, four, and fry, two, three...

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Hey, let's try to look like some cartoon characters that are about to make TV history, alright?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Action!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hi mom!

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Um... where's Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in control room with Moltar) Hiya! I'm Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hiya! I'm Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Hold it! You missed your mark.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shoot. Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Still rollin'. Go, go again.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to stage) Hiya, I'm -

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Cut!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Looks good, you look good comin' out, but, uh, Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Um, let's see if you can come up with some better words, you know? Uh, you're a superhero, feel that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) Okay, okay.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: "Hiya", it just doesn't cut it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Gotcha, I'm feelin' it. We're ready?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Alright, go.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (starts to inviso out)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Skip the inviso. (invisos back in quickly) Salutations, citizens of Earth! Space Ghost of the cosmos here, and I am commanding you to...

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Cut! Cut!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I went off, didn't I?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: It's a little strong. Almost there, but, not so... overbearing, y'know? Take a deep breath, and...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (takes a couple deep breaths)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Action!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings! I'm Space Ghost! Tonight on Space Ghost Coast to Coast, we have (monitor starts to lower early) Fred Schneider of the B-52's...

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Not yet, Moltar. (monitor raises again)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Line.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Cut! You don't have a line, Zorak. You're just playing off Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Um, I'm challenging him, to, give me a line.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Okay, but, uh, for our first show, let's try something, a little less oblique.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Easy. You caught me off guard. Sorry. (clears his throat) Um, now what's my motivation?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Okay. You're a space villain, Space Ghost has enslaved you to work on his show, just like in '68 only, more angry.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Um... okay. Ready?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: You betcha. Let him have it. And, action.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say hello to Zorak, ladies and gentlemen. My green with evil sidekick.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Fear me, O people of Earth! Memorize my grim viságe -

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Cut! "Visage", Zorak. Why, why don't you try "countenance" instead?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Countenance, huh? Alright. Fear me, O people of Earth! Memorize my grim coun - (explosion from out of nowhere blasts Zorak) (coughs)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Cut! Hang on, everybody.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Crimony! (coughs)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Uh, Joe, get in here, will you? And, uh, get some makeup on Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What's the deal here?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say, I didn't even fire.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Right. Techies, in here. This is just a glitch, people.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, uh, Bob? I gotta go.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Uh, everyone? Moltar has to go. Can someone come escort him, please.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, uh, and I'd like another coffee. And some of those biscuits, if there's any left.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Bring me some of those, uh, orange crackers with peanut butter.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (daydreaming to himself) (Space Ghost is the Cinderella story in this year's tournament, one well-placed blast and he'll take the championship. And we'll return to Augusta after these messages.)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost? Space Ghost? Space Ghost!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh? What? Hey! Hey, alrighty!

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry, man. I, I don't mean to yell like that, I just, I, I wanna try that remote segment, okay? I'm gonna have Zorak improv a little intro thing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ehh, yeah. Wwell, okay.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: And, uh, Bill, could we get Space Ghost in the banana suit, eh?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm ready when you are.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Space Ghost is going to inviso down to his mark in Atlanta.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Gotcha. Eh, where do I look? (turns to one side)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Uh, straight ahead.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (faces front again)

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: And, we're ready? Okay. And, action.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (with title logo, steel drum music starts) Ask the Big Banana. (music stops) Eh, was that okay?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Uh, give me a little more, Zorak. C'mon, stretch a little. Uh, we're still rollin', right? Okay, here we go.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat; music starts again) Hey, kids, it's time for, time to ask the questions, time for your wacky questions to the Big Banana in, outer space. (music stops) Eh, how'm I doin'?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on location in downtown Atlanta, in banana suit, his face not showing) I'm not real comfortable here, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: (aside) The suit's on backwards, this is great. (to Space Ghost) Uh, the suit's on backwards.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is that what it is?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Mostly. Um, just try to go with it, would you, please?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I... okay. Hey, you, come here.

transcript.speaker: Kaili Rubin
transcript.dialogue: Hi.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: They call me the Big Banana. Got any questions for me?

transcript.speaker: Kaili Rubin
transcript.dialogue: Uh... where's your face?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Where my face... Er, well, I'm a banana, see? Bananas don't have faces. (steel drum music)

transcript.speaker: Kaili Rubin
transcript.dialogue: Whatever. (walks off)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I've never even seen a banana in space.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, uh, it's a high concept piece.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay. That was fun. Can we try something else, Bob?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Just one more, please.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm starting to sweat, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Okay, okay. Come, come on,

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um... Bob? I, I can't reach my inviso belt. Bob? You better send a -

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Zorak, I need you to run through the, uh, over to the desk music, okay?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Alright. I had a new idea that I wanna tr- (BLAM!) (Zorak is blasted again for no reason) (coughs repeatedly)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ho ho, that's not right.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What in Andromeda's name is going on?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds back to his desk) Where are we? Did I miss something?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'd just like to see it coming, is that too much to ask?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: We're sorry, Zorak, but it's rehearsal, right, I mean, that's why we're here. Now Fran, get some makeup on Zorak again...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not sure that banana segment is working.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Ah, we'll, we'll deal with that later. You, you up on all your questions?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Eh, definitely. What are your superpowers, oxygen, got it.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Okay, we're gonna take it from the intro of our guest. Zorak, you're back, right?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes, I'm fine.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say, who's up on Friday night?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Um, it's, uh, it's not firmed up yet, but, um, we're, um, uh, we've got calls in to Johnny Carson and Barbra Streisand...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I like Streisand.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Um, and Susan Powter's on standby if anything falls through.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And Birdman waiting in the wings if you keep flubbing your intro.

transcript.speaker: Birdman
transcript.dialogue: Oh, please please, please please please please please pleeeease!

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Okay, let's go. And... action.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's welcome tonight's guest, he's one of those zany B-52's, ladies and gentlemen, let's give it up for Fred Schneider!

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: (as monitor lowers) Hello hello hello!

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: (in background) Good... good...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, citizen Fred! Welcome to my show!

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: (mechanically) Thank you very much.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you getting enough carbohydrates?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Cut! Oxygen, SG, are you getting enough oxygen.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't use it myself.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Your, your line, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just funnin' ya.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Birdman, Coast to Coast.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: And... action.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (subdued) So... Fred Schneider. Singer. Activist. Performer. Are you getting enough oxygen?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: (sarcastic) Riviting.

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: Um, no, because of hay fever, I am suffering.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry to hear that. And, eh, superpowers, got any?

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: Well, besides super-B.O., um...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Super-B.O.?

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (more animated) Well, then, get ready for a blast from my aerosol deodorant ray, mister! (aims power bands at monitor)

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Whoa! Wha, cut! (Space Ghost's teeth are clenched) Whoa! Put that, hey, put that down! Do not threaten the guest!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh...

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Hang on, people!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (to Fred) Hey man, you, uh, need anything right now?

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: Stay where you are, because you don't wanna be here.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I heard that!

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Mr. Schneider, we apologize, SG's a little nervous tonight.

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: No, not at-

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fred...

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: Huh?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look at me. Do you have any advice for me as I take on the late night talk show wars?

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: Let it happen, let it all hang out.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just sort of relax and go with it, you mean.

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, do you think I should be a serious talk show host, or just plain wacky?

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: Just do anything, who cares, just shake it. Shake it loose.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Gotcha. I'm shakin' it. So, what's this "Love Shack" all the kids are talkin' about?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Cut! Um, we're outta time. Fred, thanks for comin' in for the run-through. Would, um, would you consider doin' an actual guest spot?

transcript.speaker: Fred Schneider
transcript.dialogue: I will if you pay me enough money.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Of course. Well, um, thank you. (Fred fades from monitor, and is replaced by static) Good job, SG, eh, that feel good for you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I was horrible, I spent so much time worrying about which question to ask next, I wasn't even hearing his responses.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Well, you'll, you'll, you'll grow with it. Listen, I gotta, I gotta take this call, every-, everybody take five.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, this is somethin'. Guys like us with our own talk show, it's a testament to our continued popularity.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well... I hear it's a cost-saving method.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How do you mean?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's the 90's, Space Ghost. Network brass is openly referring to us as the "B" characters in their cartoon library. Something about "building equity".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I can't believe that! They told me -

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ah, don't get your nylons in a wad, it's just a business. I'm under no delusions about this particular gig.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, but come on! "B" characters? Maybe you and me, but Space Ghost here had his own jigsaw puzzle.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Thanks, Moltar, but Zorak's right. The only thing to do right now is put out the best darn talk show we can. (set is broken down as he speaks) Arsenio, Dave, Leno... You know, maybe it's time you fellas took a step back from the fleet lights of adulation, and took a good look around. There's a distant thunder drawing near, rolling in across the vast wasteland of popular entertainment. Maybe you can't see it coming because your view is blocked by cheap façades of skylines and cityscapes. But you'd better make ready, my friends, because this thunder is preparing to rain down fear and terror on your gilded houses of complacency! Mark my words, big shot late night gab-fest mavens, you're about to tangle with a one-dimensional caricature, and his long-forgotten arch-nemesis pals, a bug, and a... what are you anyway, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I'm a poorly drawn lava kind of a molten man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ... and a poorly drawn lava kind of a molten man! There's a new player in this late night talk show war, and his name is -

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Yeah, Bob?

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Uh, we, we need to book, man, the Snorks are in here for a promo or somethin' at 4, okay?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, uh, right, right.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, uh, who played the part of the director, anyway?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't know, some union guy.

transcript.speaker: Bob
transcript.dialogue: Cut!
